Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

Campus safety is a high priority. They have a Newark Police Station on Campus and they are always broadcasting announcements to stay safe and they also patrol Campus as well. Dorms require your ID and guests will need to be registered for the duration of their stay in your dorm room.

While I never joined any of fraternities, I can tell you that Greek life are one of the highly active organizations on campus. From fund raising for Natural Catastrophes to fun activities and on campus rock concerts, Greek Life organizations are one of the top organization for that slight distraction you might need to take a breather from studies. If you feel you belong in a Greek Life Organization, you will not go wrong at NJIT.

Many clubs and activities available at NJIT. From on campus paper called the vector to society of hispanic engineers, just about any club you can think of has a presence on campus. You can and may also start your own club as long as you follow the posted rules.

NJIT is great for students that strive for perfection and are not easily swayed. Any student that is serious about Architecture, Engineering, Information Technology, Programming, all these areas and more are highly diverse, challenging and rewarding.
None that I can think of to be honest ...

While like any form of education can be expensive, I believe NJIT offers a great bang for the buck. NJIT has been increasing its popularity is considered one of the top colleges for Technology and Innovation.
There are sports that can be done. There are 2-3 gyms available, racquet ball court, volley ball courts, a soccer field, greek life, many clubs and activities are available as well.

Food is very good as well. Students have a buffet style type of payment and are allowed to mix and match food at will in the main cafeteria. From a grill station, to salad, to pizza, odds are they have something you will like to eat and enjoy. Food is always fresh and nutritious.

Dorm life is great. The quality of all the dorms are top notch and clean. Very easy to get to your dorm and security is also taken very seriously. Guests must also be registered before they are allowed to your dorm. Cameras are also in place to also try and deter crimes.

Studying is a must especially for Mathematics and Science. As I stated before, professors will push you to your limits. Syllabuses are not only challenging, but it is guaranteed that you will learn material even if you already know the subject, you will still learn something new.

Very diverse and serious college. This college takes academics extremely seriously, you will not get a free ride, meaning, you will not just Get an A for not trying. Professors will challenge you and push you to your limits.

NJIT is challenging and diverse. I believe this college to be a perfect fit for anyone serious about the latest in technology. I highly recommend this college for a great education in all areas including, Engineering, Business and Information Technology
pageTitle: New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {176505=There are several Greek organizations on campus. The Greeks have a positive impact on the campus sponsoring safety events, raising awareness for causes and raising funds for them as well. There is a significant Greek presence on campus and a new housing facility for the Greeks will be opened fall 2013., 225328=I am currently a cadet in the Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps (AFROTC) on campus and will be attending pilot training upon completion of my bachelor' in May 2014. I have received beneficial leadership and management training that no college alone can teach., 257340=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 245381=Living on campus is ideal for time purposes, but dorm life can vary depending on the building you're in. Freshman dorms tend to have more events going on in them, while the Honors dorm tends to have a more social atmosphere. The upper class dorms tend to be somewhere in between. Honors dorm is by far the nicest (just built in 2013 I think and it looks like a hotel) while the others are pretty much the same. In these dorms, yeah you'll see cockroaches, smell weird smells, hear lots of dubstep, but whatever, it's all part of the college experience. If for some reason you decide not to live in one of NJIT's halls, there is a university apartment building right next to NJIT that I hear has reasonable prices.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Mr. Blank 01/03/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 out of 4 people found this review useful. 4 of 65 Categories Comments Bang for the buck I find it to be a little pricey, especially for the dorm and food. Am enjoying being here It can be a depressing school, weekends are dead, very little parties, but the city is a train ride away. Campus is safe. Food is horrible. Am learning a lot As an architecture major it is very hard to get a good nights rest. Unlike other majors, archies live in their studios and can stay in their for many days. There is a lot of work but there is an equal amount of learning when it comes to this school. Login to rate or flag the reviews
